column1: Tubize (Dutch: Tubeke) is a Walloon city and municipality located in the Belgian province of Walloon Brabant. On January 1
column2: 2006 Tubize had a total population of 22
column3: 335. The total area is 32.66 km2 which gives a population density of 684 inhabitants per km2.

column1: The municipality includes the former districts of Clabecq (Klabbeek)
column5: the town is home to a minority of Dutch-speakers.

column1: Les Ateliers de Tubize locomotive works was located in Tubize. At least six Tubize locomotives are preserved. One  (Tubize 2069) in Belgium
column2: two narrow gauge locomotives (2365 & 2369) in Jokioinen Museum Railways
column4: and one narrow-gauge (2179) in Poland. One locomotive is still in operation on the Pelion railway in Greece. Three are preserved in Iran
